textContent:
What are core issues in marriage with Gil? Are they longstanding or new?
- pattern of victim villain hero where Gil is the victim without her agency and I'm the hero or the villain 
- the "fixing gil" or "saving gil" pattern instead of trusting Gil
- why can't I trust Gil to be responsible for herself? She's done it her whole life. Can I say, I got you, and ask her to surrender? 

What parts of my relationship with gil are bringing me fullfilmet, joy and a sense of purpose? 
- when gil turns towards me and works with me to figure things out. When she appreciates me. When she partners with me. When she trusts me. 
- when she is confident in herself and she doesn't need me to caretake for her 
- when we parent together and are a nuclear family. When we enjoy being together and plan time together 

If I remove Arielle how do I feel about addressing the challenges with Gil? 
- I feel like it will be a continuous long and slow journey of improving and compromise
- I don't think I will ever get to the place of trust and respect and drive and connection I have with Arielle. 

If nothing about gil changes, can I accept her as she is? 
- no because it's incongruent with my value of continuously improving and striving to better oneself. 
- it's the humility to change and the awareness that more is possible that resonates deeply with me 
- I don't want to change gil. I don't want gil to change for me. I want gil to improve because she wants to live life in the most real way possible

Am I confident I've communicated my needs to gil and given her an opportunity to respond fully? 
- no. I haven't communicated what I need and want because I am scared. And because I don't want to create an ultimatum. 
- The needs I haven't said are - inventing and partnering on this journey of inventing. 
- I've communicated my need for physical and emotional intimacy
textContentHtml:
What are core issues in marriage with Gil? Are they longstanding or new?

- pattern of victim villain hero where Gil is the victim without her agency and I'm the hero or the villain 

- the "fixing gil" or "saving gil" pattern instead of trusting Gil

- why can't I trust Gil to be responsible for herself? She's done it her whole life. Can I say, I got you, and ask her to surrender? 


What parts of my relationship with gil are bringing me fullfilmet, joy and a sense of purpose? 

- when gil turns towards me and works with me to figure things out. When she appreciates me. When she partners with me. When she trusts me. 

- when she is confident in herself and she doesn't need me to caretake for her 

- when we parent together and are a nuclear family. When we enjoy being together and plan time together 


If I remove Arielle how do I feel about addressing the challenges with Gil? 

- I feel like it will be a continuous long and slow journey of improving and compromise

- I don't think I will ever get to the place of trust and respect and drive and connection I have with Arielle. 


If nothing about gil changes, can I accept her as she is? 

- no because it's incongruent with my value of continuously improving and striving to better oneself. 

- it's the humility to change and the awareness that more is possible that resonates deeply with me 

- I don't want to change gil. I don't want gil to change for me. I want gil to improve because she wants to live life in the most real way possible


Am I confident I've communicated my needs to gil and given her an opportunity to respond fully? 

- no. I haven't communicated what I need and want because I am scared. And because I don't want to create an ultimatum. 

- The needs I haven't said are - inventing and partnering on this journey of inventing. 

- I've communicated my need for physical and emotional intimacy
